json_ld.articleBody: Best-rated TV under 1 lakh? Yeah so there are actually a bunch of solid options right now from brands like LG, Samsung, Haier and Sony that give you all the cool features without going over budget. You get full 4K resolution, deep blacks, vibrant colors and the kind of picture that makes movies and games look really good. Even for sports, everything stays super smooth thanks to the high refresh rates and HDR stuff. Some even support Dolby Vision and Atmos so you get that nice cinematic feel at home without needing a seperate speaker setup or anything. Most of these TVs come with smart platforms like Android TV or WebOS or Tizen, so all your apps are there and it is pretty easy to move around the menus. Plus voice control is handy when you are too lazy to type stuff. And for gamers, it is cool that many models come with things like VRR and ALLM which basically help reduce lag and keep the visuals smooth during fast scenes. Design-wise they all look sleek and modern, super thin bezels and all that. So yeah if you are looking to upgrade your setup without spending more than 1 lakh, these TVs honestly check most of the boxes. Best-Rated TV Under 1 Lakh: Models That Offer Exceptional Visuals So there are a bunch of brands like LG, Samsung, Haier and Sony that have TVs under 1 lakh and honestly they are pretty loaded with features. You get 4K resolution which makes everything look super sharp, plus the colors are vibrant and the contrast is deep so stuff like movies and even sports look way better than on older TVs. Whether you go for OLED or QLED or one of the high-end LED ones, you still get that smooth motion and high refresh rate so nothing feels laggy or choppy. Most of them also support HDR which just makes the visuals pop more, especially during bright or really dark scenes. LG 164 cm (65 inches) 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV 65UR7500PSC (Dark Iron Gray) Alright so if you are looking for a solid 65-inch 4K TV, this LG one is honestly a pretty great pick. It has got all the smart features you would expect and then some. The picture quality is super sharp with that 3840x2160 resolution, and even tho the refresh rate is 60 Hz, it still feels really smooth for most stuff like movies and casual gaming. What is cool is the 4K upscaler it has built-in... like even if you are watching something that is not in 4K, it kinda smooths it out and sharpens it so it looks way better than the original. Colors pop, contrast is nice and deep, and honestly it just looks really good overall. The TV runs on this α5 AI Processor 4K Gen6 (I know the name sounds fancy lol), and that actually helps with both the visuals and the audio. You can def notice the difference, especially if you watch a lot of action scenes or colourful stuff. HDR 10 and HLG are there too so scenes look more real, more like what the director prob intended. Oh and speaking of that, there is Filmmaker Mode which basically turns off all the extra stuff and gives you a movie just the way the creators wanted. So no weird smoothing or filters or anything like that.SpecificationsHDR Support: HDR 10, HLGAudio: AI Sound (Virtual Surround 5.1), 20W OutputSmart OS: WebOS 23, AI ThinQGaming: Game Optimizer, ALLM, HGIG ModeConnectivity: Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 5.0, HDMI, USB, eARC, Optical, EthernetOTT Apps: Netflix, Prime Video, Disney+, Hotstar, JioCinema, YouTubeDesign: Slim, Bezel-lessProsFeature-packed smart TV with AI-powered enhancements for both picture and soundExtensive connectivity options make it easy to integrate external devicesConsThe 60Hz refresh rate may not be ideal for high-frame-rate gaming, but it works well for regular viewingWho Is It For?This one of the best 4k TV is perfect for entertainment lovers, families, and those looking for a budget-friendly television with great features. Samsung 163 cm (65 inches) 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV UA65DUE70BKLXL (Black) Okay so if you are checking out the Samsung HD Smart TV, this one really does bring that whole home-theatre kinda vibe without being crazy expensive. Picture quality is actually super solid thanks to the Crystal Processor 4K. Even stuff that is not in 4K looks better because of the upscaling and all that UHD dimming and HDR 10+ magic. Colors look vibrant and clean, and that PurColor tech makes everything just pop on screen. It has got Motion Xcelerator too which keeps things smooth when stuff is moving fast, so action scenes and sports def look better. Refresh rate is 50Hz which is not super high but still works fine for most stuff, esp if you are not hardcore gaming. Sound on this TV is actually pretty decent too. It has got 20W dual speakers with Q-Symphony and Object Tracking Sound which basically makes it feel like sound is moving with the action on screen. You kinda get that surround sound effect without needing a soundbar, tho if you have one it syncs well with it. Plus Adaptive Sound tweaks audio based on what you are watching which is a nice touch.SpecificationsHDR Support: HDR 10+Audio: 20W speakers with Q-Symphony and Object Tracking SoundSmart OS: Tizen OS with Bixby, Alexa, and Google Assistant supportGaming: Auto Game Mode (ALLM), VRR, and HGIG supportConnectivity: Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, HDMI, USB, EthernetDisplay Features: PurColor, UHD Dimming, Motion XceleratorDesign: Slim and modern with wall-mount and table-mount optionsProsEnhanced picture quality with 4K upscaling, UHD Dimming, and HDR 10+Smart features like voice control, AirPlay, and SmartThings integrationCons50Hz refresh rate may not be ideal for fast-paced gamingWho Is It For?Ideal for home entertainment enthusiasts who want a cinematic viewing experience with a television from one of the best tv brands as they come up with greater credibility and better after-sale services. Haier 165 cm (65 inches) QLED -Smart Google TV with Hands Free Voice Control 65S800QT (Grey) The Haier 55-inch 4K QLED TV is built for those who want a premium viewing experience without overspending. Featuring a QLED 4K HDR display, it delivers vivid colors, deep contrasts, and sharp details, making movies, sports, and gaming more immersive. MEMC technology ensures smooth visuals, while DLG 120Hz enhances motion clarity. Micro Dimming and Dolby Vision further refine picture quality for lifelike images. The bezel-less metal design with a slim stand adds a modern touch to any space. Running on Google TV, it provides seamless access to apps like Netflix, Prime Video, and YouTube, while built-in Google Assistant and Far-Field Voice Control allow hands-free operation. Google Chromecast lets users stream content effortlessly. Sound is powered by 30W Dolby Atmos speakers, creating a 3D immersive audio experience. For gamers, ALLM (Auto Low Latency Mode), Game Mode, and a 60Hz refresh rate ensure responsive and smooth gameplay. With Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, USB, HDMI, and Ethernet connectivity, this Haier TV offers multiple ways to connect devices. Packed with advanced technology, the 55-inch TV is an excellent choice for home entertainment, combining stunning visuals, smart features, and rich audio performance.SpecificationsProcessor: Google TVAudio: 30W Dolby AtmosGaming: ALLM Game ModeSmart Features: Chromecast, Netflix, Prime VideoDesign: Slim, bezel-less metalConnectivity: Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, HDMI, USBBrightness: High brightness contrastStorage: 2GB RAM, 32GB storageProsVibrant QLED Display – It delivers rich colors, deep contrast, and sharp 4K clarity.Powerful Dolby Atmos Sound – This creates an immersive 3D audio experience for movies and music.Cons60Hz Refresh Rate – Not the best for high-speed competitive gaming.Who Is It For?This one of the best 55 inch TV is ideal for home entertainment lovers who want stunning visuals, rich sound, and smart features at a reasonable price. Great for casual gamers, movie watchers, and smart home users. Blacks are deep, colors are vibrant and the contrast really pops, like everything just feels more real on screen. The XR Contrast Pro feature makes bright areas stand out without losing detail in the darker parts, which is great if you watch a lot of movies or shows with a lot of dramatic lighting. acceptedAnswer.text: Multiple HDMI and USB ports, dual-band Wi-Fi, and Bluetooth ensure smooth integration with soundbars, gaming consoles, and streaming devices. Built-in Chromecast, Apple AirPlay, and screen mirroring allow easy content sharing from different devices.

mainEntity.name: What features should you look for in the under-1-lakh TV price range?

acceptedAnswer.text: It should offer 4K UHD resolution, HDR support, and a high refresh rate for smooth motion.
